summary: "Anne of Green Gables" is a classic novel by L.M. Montgomery, published in 1908. It tells the story of Anne Shirley, an 11-year-old orphan mistakenly sent to live with middle-aged siblings Matthew and Marilla Cuthbert, who wanted to adopt a boy. Set in the late 19th century, the book follows Anne's adventures in the fictional town of Avonlea, Canada. It's been translated into many languages, sold over 50 million copies, and adapted into movies, TV shows, and plays. Montgomery wrote many sequels, and a prequel was published in 2008.
title: Anne of Green Gables
